title: US Banks may not be out of the woods
text: Saved by the Fed. Federal Reserve programs, estimated at $6 trillion after some $2 trillion in promised fiscal stimulus last week, have averted a Depression-era crisis for US banks, some analysts say.

title: Economy/Markets: SNAFU – The Shape Of The Recovery
text: We don’t yet know if March 23rd will be the low for the DJIA. And when it comes, the economic recovery, will look more like a rising “L” than a “V”.

title: Ackman says Pershing Square no longer has hedges on stocks
text: William Ackman’s Pershing Square Capital Management no longer has hedges on its stock portfolio, but still has some cash to invest if equities decline further as the United States battles the coronavirus outbreak, the billionaire investor said on Saturday.

title: 20 More Stock Picks For The Coronavirus Economy, According To Market Experts
text: Even though the coronavirus has caused unprecedented market volatility, there are still good deals to be had for investors.

title: Handicapping The Future Of Financial Markets
text: Evidence-based views of COVID-19 and market history can help us navigate the uncertainties of current financial markets.

title: Bear Market For Stocks Continues Even As The Dow Holds 18,000
text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average traded as low as 18,213.65 on March 23 then rebounded by about 23%.

title: Sell High or Sell Low, Overall Stock Market Weakness is Inevitable
text: The financial markets love the stimulus from by both the Banks and the Government. Or at least, we can thank both as to why the stock market stopped the bleeding and rallied, in some cases over 20% off the lows.

title: Coronavirus Cases Soar Above 645,000; Turning Point In Sight For U.S., Europe, Stock Market?
text: Coronavirus cases worldwide have topped 645,000 as U.S. Covid-19 infections soar.

title: GeekWire Podcast: Coronavirus hits tech economy; life under lockdown; and a poem for our new era
text: Here’s what we’re talking about this week on the GeekWire Podcast.

title: Why The U.S. Is Now In Recession
text: It appears virtually certain the U. S. will see a 2020 recession.

title: A $10 Trillion Response to the Global Pandemic
text: Last week I was introduced to a board game called Pandemic. In the game, players are up against the clock to find the cure to viral outbreaks and contain them before they spread across the entire globe.

title: Complacency to chaos: how Covid-19 sent the world’s markets into freefall
text: Governments and investors woke up too late to the crisis. Now they are facing the deepest global recession in history

title: The market is so haywire some Wall Street strategists threw in the towel on giving S&P 500 targets
text: Chief market strategists at BMO Capital, Oppenheimer and Canaccord Genuity have all suspended their year-end targets on the S&P 500.

title: The Coronavirus Recession Deepens: ‘This Is Not A One-Quarter Event’
text: The idea floating around Wall Street that the U.S. economy will bounce right back after millions of Americans are done hunkering down in their homes appears increasingly preposterous.

title: Trump pushes back against congressional oversight for $500 billion bailout fund
text: Democrats cheered the addition of an inspector general as a victory, but Trump said the watchdog needs his permission to make reports to Congress.

title: This is the biggest lesson investors can learn from recent exchange-traded note liquidations: CIO
text: There are differences between ETFs and exchange-traded notes that are worth remembering. Certain ETNs liquidate during historic market swings, industry leaders say.

title: Bill Ackman Bet On Market Plummet, Turned $27M Into $2.6B
text: Bill Ackman bet on a winner amid the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic. On March 18, the founder of Pershing Square Capital said on CNBC that at the rate the coronavirus is spreading, the American economy will enter a "depression-era period" and as many as a million Americans could die.

title: The Great Municipal Bond ETF Freeze-Out
text: I want to begin by saying that, despite the disquieting events of the past three weeks, the structure of municipal bond ETFs, which have proven to be both efficient and effective in the delivery of tax-free income, remains intact.

title: Leon Cooperman, Others Weigh In On Whether The Stock Market Has Hit Bottom
text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average finished Friday's session down more than 4%. This marks a reversal from a three-day winning streak where major indices gained more than 20% from Monday's close.
